summary: The 'Decoupling from Foreign Adversarial Battery Dependence Act' prohibits the Department of Homeland Security from procuring batteries made by specific foreign entities, primarily those based in China, starting October 1, 2027. The bill outlines exceptions for research purposes or if the Secretary of Homeland Security determines no viable alternatives exist, contingent on certain assessments and Congressional notification.  A report detailing the impact of this upon the Department of Homeland Security must be submitted within 180 days after enactment.
